Which of the following is true for variable names in C?
answer_1: They can contain alphanumeric characters as well as special characters
answer_2: It is not an error to declare a variable to be one of the keywords(like goto, static)
answer_3: Variable names cannot start with a digit
answer_4: Variable can be of any length
rightAnswer: Variable names cannot start with a digit

title: Which of following is not accepted in C?
answer_3: static static int a; //a static variable prefixed with static
rightAnswer: static static int a; //a static variable prefixed with static

title: Property which allows to produce different executable for different platforms in C is called?

The C-preprocessors are specified with _________ symbol.
How is search done in #include and #include “somelibrary.h” according to C standard?
answer_1: When former is used, current directory is searched and when latter is used, standard directory is searched
answer_2: When former is used, standard directory is searched and when latter is used, current directory is searched
answer_3: When former is used, search is done in implementation defined manner and when latter is used, current directory is searched
answer_4: For both, search for ‘somelibrary’ is done in implementation-defined places
rightAnswer: When former is used, standard directory is searched and when latter is used, current directory is searched
